creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: front of big church with two spires; light gray coloring
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date

inscribed in graphite at bottom of sheet: [A 294 | F 290 / \"Notre Dame the Tiny\" / (West Facade of the Cathedral of Notre Dame, Paris) / (Christmas Card, 1935) | Private Collection E / John Taylor Arms | NYPL #294 E.W. Estate / E / sp]

-- titled within image at bottom edge: [Notre Dame the Tiny]
-- in graphite on bottom of mount: 1 1/2 x 13/16
-- in graphite on front of mat: #77 | 125
provenance: Private collection of the artist, Collection E; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed and dated in graphite[?] directly below image, at right: [John Taylor Arms / 1935]; signed in graphite below platemark: [III John Taylor Arms 1935]
title: Notre Dame the Tiny (West Façade of Cathedral of Notre Dame, Paris)
